This project uses three primary datasets retrieved from reputable external data providers.  
Below are the official sources and descriptions:

---

## **World Bank API Data**
Two datasets were retrieved using the World Bank Indicators API:

- **Life Expectancy at Birth (years)**  

- **GDP per Capita**  

---

## **CO₂ Emissions Data (Our World in Data)**  
This dataset contains a multitude of CO₂ emission statistics. For this project we only focused on Co2 Per Capita:

- **Our World in Data CO₂ Dataset (GitHub Repository)**  
  [OWID CO₂ Dataset (GitHub)](https://github.com/owid/co2-data)


---

# Raw Dataset Preview

Below you can preview each dataset as it was retrieved.

---

## **World Bank — Life Expectancy Data**
_File: `data/raw/worldbank_life_expectancy_simple.csv`_

```{python}
import pandas as pd
from itables import init_notebook_mode, show
import itables
itables.options.warn_on_undocumented_option = False
init_notebook_mode(all_interactive=True)

life_df = pd.read_csv("../data/raw/worldbank_life_expectancy_simple.csv")
show(
    life_df,
    paging=True,
    searchable=True,
    scrollY="400px",
    scrollX=True,
    lengthMenu=[10, 25, 50, 100],
    classes="display compact nowrap"
)
```

## **Our World in Data — CO₂ Emissions Dataset**
_File: `data/external/owid-co2-data.csv`_

```{python}
co2_raw = pd.read_csv("../data/external/owid-co2-data.csv")

# Keep only the required columns
co2_filtered = co2_raw[["iso_code", "year", "co2_per_capita"]].copy()

# Filter to years >= 1990
co2_filtered = co2_filtered[co2_filtered["year"] >= 1990]

# Display interactive table
show(
    co2_filtered,
    paging=True,
    searchable=True,
    scrollY="400px",
    scrollX=True,
    lengthMenu=[10, 25, 50, 100],
    classes="display compact nowrap")
```

# Notes

- The raw datasets shown here represent the original inputs retrieved directly from the World Bank API and the OWID CO₂ repository.

- Before modeling, the data undergoes multiple preprocessing steps, including:

  - Filtering invalid or missing values as an example, there were many countries with no recorded CO₂ emissions before 1990.

  - Selecting consistent time ranges. For CO₂ data, we start at 1990 to ensure every country has non-zero emissions and to avoid introducing bias from sparse early-century reporting.

  - Renaming and restructuring columns for consistency across all sources.

  - Merging datasets by ISO code (iso3) and year to create a unified analytic dataset containing life expectancy, GDP per capita, CO₂ per capita, and continent.

  - Adding continent information from a lookup table to support geographic visualizations.

- No modeling, scaling, or feature engineering is performed on this page. Its purpose is to provide full transparency into the exact raw inputs used before cleaning.

- A fully cleaned and merged dataset is used in all modeling and visualization sections of this website.
